abstract: AT&T announced on Sunday that it had agreed to buy T-Mobile USA from Deutsche Telekom for $39 billion, in a deal that would create the largest carrier in the nation and promised to reshape the industry.
snippet: AT&T announced on Sunday that it had agreed to buy T-Mobile USA from Deutsche Telekom for $39 billion, in a deal that would create the largest carrier in the nation and promised to reshape the industry.
lead_paragraph: 12:16 a.m. | Updated AT&T announced on Sunday that it had agreed to buy T-Mobile USA from Deutsche Telekom for $39 billion, in a deal that would create the largest wireless carrier in the nation and promised to reshape the industry.

headline.main: AT&T to Buy T-Mobile USA for $39 Billion

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Michael J. de la Merced and Jenna Wortham

abstract: With AT&T moving to buy T-Mobile USA, telecom companies are now the second most active deal-makers, behind the oil and gas industry.
snippet: With AT&T moving to buy T-Mobile USA, telecom companies are now the second most active deal-makers, behind the oil and gas industry.
lead_paragraph: With AT&T moving to buy T-Mobile USA for $39 billion, telecom companies are now the second most active deal-makers in the world.

abstract: DealBook breaks down the list of advisers who worked on the latest telecom megadeal, AT&T’s $39 billion purchase of T-Mobile USA.
snippet: DealBook breaks down the list of advisers who worked on the latest telecom megadeal, AT&T’s $39 billion purchase of T-Mobile USA.
lead_paragraph: More than a few banks and law firms will be ringing up handsome fees for putting together AT&T‘s $39 billion bid for T-Mobile USA.

headline.main: The Advisers Behind the AT&T Deal

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED
